page.title: 08L'pool Newsham,Local History
page.content: Newsham is derived from land once known as Neusam, Newsam or Newshum which comes from the Anglo_Saxon word Nuvehusum_"the new houses". Early records show that this area although in the township of Walton also extended well into the region which became known as the township of West Derby. Newsham House, now known as "The Judges House", was built near the end of the 18th century by Thomas Molyneux (no relation to the Earls of Sefton) and was bought by Liverpool Corporation in 1846. It has been a guest house for VIP's such as Queen Victoria (1886), Princess Beatrice (1886), The Duke of Connaught (1892) and the Duke and Duchess of York (later George Vth AND Queen Mary) in 1893.
